intro: Sebaea sedoides, commonly known as the common sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested. Sebaea sedoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
